etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, "wood") + 爾(爾) (ěr, phonetic) = wood implement related to weaving -> loom
etymology.interpretation: The character 檷(nǐ) combines 木(木) (mù, "wood"), indicating a wooden object, with the phonetic component 爾(爾) (ěr), suggesting the pronunciation. This combination signifies a wooden tool associated with weaving, hence the meaning "loom."
